articles.title: EFL latest: Sheff Utd agree Tanganga fee with Millwall

articles.subheading: Sheff Utd agree Tanganga fee with Millwall
articles.content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Peter Smith and Sky in Italy's Luca Bendoni: Sheffield United have agreed a fee with Millwall for defender Japhet Tanganga. The clubs are now working to finalise the last details of the deal. Tanganga was left out of Millwall's squad for yesterday's 1-0 win at the Blades. Millwall boss Alex Neil said Tanganga was absent due to talks over a move away progressing. Neil said: “The fact that I took him out of the game, obviously, things have moved on. "As far as I know, things are not at a conclusion stage just now. I had a good chat with Japhet earlier today. So we’ll see what transpires over the next couple of days.”

articles.title: West Ham latest: 'Potter not at risk of sacking currently'

articles.subheading: 'Potter not at risk of sacking currently'
articles.content: Graham Potter's position as West Ham head coachis safe for now, according to the Daily Mail. However, the 50-year-old must oversee an immediate improvement in form for the Hammers if he is to continue in the role. Potter was appointed as Julien Lopetegui's successor in January, with his side starting the 2025/26 season with back-to-back losses to Sunderland and Chelsea. It is said that the former Chelsea and Brighton back is expected to be in charge of the club for the next games against Wolves in the Carabao Cup and Nottingham Forest in the Premier League.

articles.title: Chelsea latest: Dortmund agree double deal for Blues duo

articles.subheading: Dortmund agree double deal for Chelsea duo Chukwuemeka and Anselmino
articles.content: Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: Borussia Dortmund have reached a full agreement with Chelsea over the signings of Carney Chukwuemeka and Aaron Anselmino. The deal for Chukwuemeka is permanent and worth around £24m, including add-ons. Meanwhile, Anselmino is set to join the German club on a straight loan. Once Chukwuemeka's exit is sealed, Chelsea will have generated more than £270m in player sales.

Aston Villa have made contact for Chelsea forward Christopher Nkunku, according to Fabrizio Romano. The 27-year-old is reportedly an option for Unai Emery's side before the end of the season. Bayern Munich and RB Leipzig are also interested in Nkunku. Sky Sports News reported earlier in August that Chelsea rejected a loan move offer from Bayern, with both the player and club wanting a permanent exit. Chelsea value Nkunku, who has four years remaining on his current deal, at £43m.

articles.title: Aston Villa latest: 'Contact made for Chelsea's Nkunku'

articles.content: Aston Villa have made contact for Chelsea forward Christopher Nkunku, according to Fabrizio Romano. The 27-year-old is reportedly an option for Unai Emery's side before the end of the season. Bayern Munich and RB Leipzig are also interested in Nkunku. Sky Sports News reported earlier in August that Chelsea rejected a loan move offer from Bayern, with both the player and club wanting a permanent exit. Chelsea value Nkunku, who has four years remaining on his current deal, at £43m.

articles.subheading: Emery: We have to perform with the players we have
articles.content: Unai Emery suggests Aston Villa may have to prepare to continue with their current defensive options as the transfer window draws to a close. Villa were beaten 1-0 at Brentford on Saturday, with Ezri Konsa suspended after picking up a red card in their opening draw vs Newcastle. Emery's side have been linked to signing a defender to bolster options at the back. However, asked about Konsa's absence affecting the team, Emery said: "We have to be ready to play with the centre-backs we have. "We have to perform with the players we have. I think it’s enough players to get enough performances for this season. “But this week is the last week for the transfer window and of course, we have some circumstances that are not helping us.”

articles.title: Rashford subbed at half-time before stunning Barcelona comeback

articles.subheading: Rashford subbed at half-time before Barca mount comeback
articles.content: Marcus Rashford was substituted at half-time before Barcelona left it late to beat Levante 3-2. The La Liga champions went two-nil down in the first half thanks to goals from Ivan Romero and Jose Morales but battled back after the restart. Hansi Flick substituted Rashford and Marc Casado for Gavi and Dani Olmo at the break, with Pedri then pulling a goal back for Barca within three minutes of the changes with a stunner from long-range. Ferran Torres netted the equaliser shortly after (52) and an Unai Elgezabal Udondo own-goal in the 91st minute then secured all three points, lifting the visitors to the top of the table.

articles.subheading: Rowe joins Bologna after Marseille bust-up with Rabiot
articles.content: England U21 international Jonathan Rowe has joined Bologna in a permanent move from Marseille after he was transfer-listed by the French club following a bust-up with Adrien Rabiot. Rowe and Rabiot clashed in a heated argument after the opening Ligue 1 loss at Rennes, which was widely reported in France to have become physical. The ex-Norwich forward has now found a new club after sealing a £16.9m (€19.5m) move to Serie A side Bologna, with Marseille having a 10 per cent sell-on clause in the deal.
